adjective.description: Designating, exhibiting, or relating to origin from, or involvement of, several sites in the body or an organ.
Biology. Of a chromosome: having more than one centromere; specifically having more than two centromeres.
Generally. Relating to or having many centres or foci.
Medicine. Of a study or trial: = "multicentre".

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Proceedings of the Royal Society of London. From multi- + -centric.
